instruction: My favorite witty review of The Rings of Power series is this:
output:
“If you think the Lord of the Rings movies were too long, wait until you get a load of The Rings of Power TV series. Seriously, I think they're going to be just as bad as Game of Thrones only with elves and rings instead of dragons and swords.”
That captures the spirit of the show pretty well, doesn’t it?
As I sat down to watch the first episode, I was immediately taken aback by how much time the show spent on exposition and world-building. This is understandable, but after watching the first hour, I realized that this is all we’re going to get for at least the next three episodes. I’d be surprised if there’s much plot progression over the next few episodes. If the story of The Fellowship of the Ring was told in the style of The Rings of Power, we’d have watched them go through a lot of training and preparation before setting out on their journey. That would’ve been boring.
The problem with adapting such a massive work is that you can’t fit it all into one show. It’s unreasonable to expect a show to do so. Even the Lord of the Rings trilogy had to cut some stuff out, and that still felt overstuffed. But in order to make up for what was lost, they simply add more.
All of that being said, I’m still looking forward to learning more about the world of The Rings of Power. I want to know more about the orcs and the Nazgûl. I want to see more of Sauron and Galadriel. And I want to learn more about the other characters who will likely form the Fellowship. There is definitely some interesting world-building here. But it feels like it’s taking away from the actual storytelling. Hopefully as the

instruction: You will be asked to answer the following question as part of the LinkedIn Skill assessments.
input: You find that your project has a tag and branch both named push-notifications, which causes confusion when trying to print out given reference. How can you specify which branch you want to look at?
output:
The question is asking about a situation where a project has two branches named push-notifications, which causes confusion when trying to print out the given reference. The asker wants to know how they can specify which branch they want to look at.
To specify which branch you want to look at, you can use the -b or --branch option in the git command line interface. Here's an example command:
git checkout -b my_new_feature origin/push-notifications
In this command, "origin/push-notifications" specifies the branch you want to switch to. The "my_new_feature" branch is created in the current branch.

instruction: You should write a Product Description that will persuade the buyer that the product is beneficial.
input: Flipslide Game, Electronic Handheld Game | Flip, Slide, and Match the Colors to Beat the Clock - 4 Game Modes - Multiplayer Fun
output:
- Travel Game for Kids and Adults
The Flipslide game is a great gift for traveling, family game night, or just about any gathering. It's a fun game to play with friends and family of all ages. The goal is to match the colors on the game board as quickly as possible while racing against the clock and your opponent. With 4 different game modes, there's never a dull moment!
In Match mode, you have 30 seconds to slide the colorful tiles around and match them up in vertical or horizontal rows of three or more. The faster you are, the higher your score.
In Slide mode, you need to slide the tiles to create matches as quickly as possible, but be careful not to make any mistakes. If you make a wrong move, you'll have to start over from the beginning.
In Bomb mode, you have 60 seconds to slide the tiles around and match them up in vertical or horizontal rows of three or more. However, there's a twist - every other turn, you'll reveal a "bomb" tile that will end your game if you touch it.
In Score Attack mode, you'll compete against the clock and your opponent to see who can get the highest score by matching the tiles as quickly as possible.
With its compact size and portable design, the Flipslide game is perfect for taking on the go. It's also a great way to pass the time on long car rides, flights, or waiting rooms. Whether you're playing solo or with friends and family, this game is sure to provide hours of fun and excitement.
Material: ABS Plastic, Acrylic Lens
Color: Multi-color (Assorted)

instruction: Give a brief description of the given category of movies and shows.
input: Period Dramas
output:
: These movies and TV shows are set in a specific time period, typically the past. The settings, costumes, and plot lines often reflect the cultural norms and social attitudes of that time period. Popular period dramas include "Downton Abbey," "The Tudors," and "The Crown."
Comedies: These movies and TV shows are designed to make audiences laugh. They often feature humorous situations, quirky characters, and witty dialogue. Some comedies are satirical, while others rely on physical comedy or slapstick. Popular comedies include "The Big Bang Theory," "Modern Family," and "Ghostbusters."
Action Movies: These films feature high-octane stunts, explosions, and fight scenes. Action movies often have a hero or heroine who must overcome seemingly insurmountable odds to save the day. Popular action movies include "The Matrix," "Fast & Furious," and "Jason Bourne."
Horror Movies: These films are designed to scare audiences with suspenseful plots, gruesome special effects, and sometimes supernatural elements. Popular horror movies include "The Shining," "The Exorcist," and "The Conjuring."
Documentaries: These nonfiction films explore real events or historical figures, often with an emphasis on education and informing the audience about a particular topic. Documentaries can cover a wide range of topics, from science and technology to politics and history. Popular documentaries include "Blackfish," "Fahrenheit 9/11," and "American Movie."

instruction:
Write a simple guide for uploading the bibliography database
 on Overleaf.
output:
#Bibliography Management with Zotero
Overleaf is a web-based collaborative writing and publishing tool. By default, Overleaf integrates with the Zotero reference manager, which you can use to store your references in a library. This guide will explain how to upload your Zotero database to Overleaf to use as a bibliography and citations manager. 
1. Go to https://www.overleaf.com/ and sign up for an account if you haven't already done so.
2. On the Overleaf homepage, click on 'Start Writing'. You can also click on the 'Upload Template' button at the top of the page to select from a variety of templates for different types of documents.
3. Once you have started writing your document, click on the 'References' tab in the top menu bar (next to 'Home'). 
4. Click on the 'Add New Reference' button to add a new reference to your bibliography. A window will pop up asking for details about the reference.
5. To upload your Zotero library, click on the 'Browse' button next to 'Select an existinglibrary'. A file browser will open. 
6. Navigate to your Zotero library folder and select it. The contents of this folder are your Zotero library. 
7. Click on 'Open' and the references in your library will be added to your bibliography. You can now modify any of these references by editing the corresponding fields in the 'Add New Reference' window. When you are finished adding references, click on the 'Save all changes' button in the bottom right corner.
8. You can now add or remove references from your bibliography as needed. Changes to the bibliography will be saved automatically when you close the 'References' tab.
9. If you need to edit the format of your references

instruction: You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.
input:
I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output:
I've never ditched anyone or been ditched before so I feel a bit embarrassed to be asking for advice but need to figure out how to do this tactfully.
Edit: Thanks for your replies guys, we ended up having a very civil conversation and he has decided to go home early. We’re both sad it didn’t work out but at least we parted on good terms. I’ll be going solo for the rest of the trip which is exactly what I needed. The biggest concern was him getting upset and making a scene on the ferry, but he was very understanding.
My best friend is driving me crazy. How can I tell her she is ruining my trip without starting an argument?
So you’re spending almost 2 weeks in a car with someone who doesn’t want to talk to you? If you’re not willing to compromise and put in some effort to make conversation, why did you ask him to split the cost of the rental car and hotels? I know people are different but if you were like this with me, I would have dumped you on the side of the road! You can see my point now?
I think you should sit down and have a chat with him and tell him how you feel. He may not even realise that he’s being insular and just needs someone to point it out.
The thing is he is travelling with a close friend and isn’t looking to change. So I think it’s pretty important to get his perspective too. Neither of them seem keen to talk about anything much but I don’t think it’s because they don’t want to chat.. it’s more because they just aren’t interested in the same things and don’t enjoy the same activities. It’s possible he feels bad about imposing his interests on her but also doesn’t want

instruction: You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information.
input: Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.
output:
The teams will take the field wearing anti-discrimination armbands with the slogan “#EqualGame” on them during their European qualifying matches for the 2022 World Cup.
According to a press release, the participating teams are “committed to opposing discrimination of any kind, including homophobia, biphobia and transphobia.”
FIFA has not yet commented on the issue.
Sources: UEFA, The Guardian
In recent years, there has been an upswing in incidents of hateful speech and actions towards LGBTQ+ individuals. Many European football teams have taken a stand against such behavior by supporting the OneLove campaign. The Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland, Wales, and other teams have all come together to show their support for the cause. They will be wearing armbands with a special message to promote inclusion and oppose discrimination during their European qualifying matches for the 2022 World Cup.
Though FIFA has yet to comment on the issue, it is clear that the teams are committed to standing up for what they believe in.

instruction: Using the provided topic as a starting point, brainstorm ideas for videos that can be made about it on YouTube.
input: In spite of the fact that procrastination feels bad to you, why do you do it?
output:
This video will explore its benefits and how to use it to your advantage.
Hello everyone, and welcome to my YouTube channel! In this video, I'm going to talk about why people procrastinate and whether or not there are any benefits to it. I'll also give some tips on how to use procrastination to your advantage. So sit back, relax, and let's get started.
Have you ever felt like you just can't seem to get anything done? Like no matter how hard you try, you always find yourself putting things off until the last minute? If so, then you're not alone. Procrastination is a common problem that affects people all over the world. But why does it happen? And is there any benefit to it?
One reason people procrastinate is because they think it will reduce their stress levels. When we have a lot of work to do, we often feel anxious and overwhelmed. By putting it off, we hope to reduce our stress levels and make the task seem less daunting. However, research has shown that procrastination actually increases stress levels, not reduces them.
Another reason people procrastinate is because they think they work better under pressure. They believe that by waiting until the last minute, they'll be able to produce better work. The truth is, though, that when we procrastinate, our work often suffers. We may end up rushing through it, making mistakes, or even abandoning it altogether.
So what can you do if you find yourself procrastinating? The first step is to acknowledge that it's a problem. Once you've admitted to yourself that you have a procrastination issue, you can start looking for ways to deal with it.
One strategy is to break down your tasks into smaller, more manageable chunks. By doing

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
A merge conflict occurs when two or more people contribute changes to a file at the same time. GitHub attempts to resolve these conflicts automatically. If the conflict is not resolved, you can manually resolve it by editing the file and committing your changes.
1. Open the pull request that has a merge conflict.
2. Navigate to the "Files in Conflict" tab.
3. Review the changes that are in conflict.
4. Edit the file to resolve the conflict.
5. Add or remove whitespace as needed to ensure both changes are visible.
6. Save the file.
7. Check to make sure there are no more conflicts and click the "Resolve All" button.
8. Review the changes that were applied to resolve the conflict.
9. If everything looks good, click the "Merge" button.
10. If there are any unmerged files, go back to the "Files in Conflict" tab and resolve the remaining conflicts.
11. Once all conflicts are resolved, click the "Merge" button again.
12. If you have commits that were made outside of the pull request, you will be prompted to merge those commits as well.
13. Click the "Confirm merge" button.
14. The pull request will now be merged and the changes will be merged into the main branch.

instruction: You are given two questions. Check if they are duplicates.
input:
Question1: I am trying to understand the advantages of multiprocessing over threading. I know that multiprocessing gets around the Global Interpreter Lock, but what other advantages are there, and can threading not do the same thing?
Question2: I am learning how to use the threading and the multiprocessing modules in Python to run certain operations in parallel and speed up my code.
I am finding this hard (maybe because I don't have any theoretical background about it) to understand what the difference is between a threading.Thread() object and a multiprocessing.Process() one.
Also, it is not entirely clear to me how to instantiate a queue of jobs and having only 4 (for example) of them running in parallel, while the other wait for resources to free before being executed.
I find the examples in the documentation clear, but not very exhaustive; as soon as I try to complicate things a bit, I receive a lot of weird errors (like a method that can't be pickled, and so on).
So, when should I use the threading and multiprocessing modules?
Can you link me to some resources that explain the concepts behind these two modules and how to use them properly for complex tasks?
output:
In this post, I'll try to give an answer to Question1. In another post, I'll address Question2.
Global Interpreter Lock (GIL) is a superset of the problem that needs to be solved.
Both multiprocessing and threading provide ways to create new processes or threads, respectively. While both allow you to create new threads or processes, they solve different problems.
If you are just starting out with parallel programming in Python, go ahead and use threading for now. Multiprocessing might confuse you more than help at this point.
There are different types of parallelism:
Task parallelism - Running multiple tasks in parallel, each taking some time to complete.
Data parallelism - Splitting a big array or dataset into smaller chunks and running multiple processors on each chunk.
This distinction applies to both threading and multiprocessing. If you have a function which operates on a small input, say 100 integers, and if the computation takes, say, 1 second, then you can run it in parallel with other such functions using either threading or multiprocessing. This is task parallelism.
If you have a very large number of elements, say 1 million, and the time complexity of your operation is O(n), then you can split the array into smaller chunks, say 100 elements each, and run multiple processors on each. This is data parallelism.
So, while you can use threading to create new threads and multiprocessing to create new processes, essentially all of the interesting differences between them boil down to how they manage CPU resources.
Multiprocessing uses forking, which creates a new process and creates a brand new environment for the child process. The issue with this approach is that shared state (e.g. global variables, open files

instruction: Think of topics that are most common in classic interview questions for a job in computer science.
output:
région: Amérique du Nord. As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences, but here are some common computer science interview questions that you can practice: 1. What is the difference between a stack and a queue?
What would you say are the most important qualities for someone pursuing a career in computer science?
What are some of the most challenging aspects of working in computer science?
What types of problems have you been able to solve using computer science?

instruction: You will need to guide this person through the scenario they have described for the interview.
input:
Finally! After a while of shooting in the dark and frantically fiddling with sample inputs on the whiteboard, you've came up with an algorithm for solving the coding question your interviewer gave you.
Whew. Such a relief to have a clear path forward. To not be flailing anymore.
Now you're cruising, getting ready to code up your solution.
When suddenly, your interviewer throws you a curve ball.
"What if we thought of the problem this way?"
You feel a tension we've all felt during the coding interview:
"Try to listen to what they're saying...but don't lose your train of thought...ugh, I can't do both!"
output:
As the interviewer describes their new perspective on the problem, you feel yourself start to lose the path you had so carefully mapped out.
Your mind starts racing: What if they're right? What if I missed something? What if I look stupid now?
This is a classic dilemma - how do you stay focused on what you know and simultaneously listen to what your interviewer has to say?
Here's what I recommend:
1. Respond with a nod or an "mm-hmm" to acknowledge that you're listening
2. Ask questions for clarification as needed (e.g. "Can you explain more about why we should think of it this way?")
3. Take notes - either physically or in your head - to help you keep track of their new perspective
4. If necessary, reiterate the original problem statement to make sure you're on the same page
5. Once you're confident that you understand their new perspective, then go back to constructing your solution based on the old problem statement.
Good luck! You've got this!

instruction: You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem.
input:
Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;
output:
Explanation:
The SELECT statement selects the columns FirstName, LastName, City, and State from the Person table. The LEFT JOIN keyword joins the Address table on the PersonId column in the same order as the SELECT statement.
If there is no matching row in the Address table for a given PersonId, the corresponding value in the Result table is NULL.

instruction: Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.
input: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output:
The fair trade movement has and still is growing steadily, as of 2014 the market for fair trade certified products was worth a little over €55 billion globally. As of 2013, the top three producer countries of Fairtrade Certified commodities were Mexico, India and the Ivory Coast, accounting for 48% of all products sold globally. The largest importer of Fairtrade Certified products was the United States, followed by the Netherlands and Germany.
The concepts underlying the fair trade movement have been discussed since the 19th century. One of the first people to promote fair trade was the sociologist and economist Robert Owen. In 1824, he recommended that manufacturers pay their workers enough so they could afford to buy the products they made. This idea was reinforced in 1946 by John Maynard Keynes who wrote: "At the heart of the economic system we must put human beings. Human beings or, more accurately, human fertility. We forget this at our peril." In the early 1960s, E. F. Schumacher, author of Small Is Beautiful, called for an economy based on "Buddhist economics" and promoting "intermediate technology", which would allow poorer countries to develop their industrial base with minimal use of capital- or energy-intensive methods.
In 1947, Raoul Dahl regarding Fair Trade: "Fair Trade is not charity but the hand-up, not the hand-out, needed to make possible the building of a better world."
Fair Trade pioneers from Europe travelled to coffee-growing regions of Latin America, such as Chiapas, Mexico, and met with producers (coffee growers). They learned about their living and

instruction: Please answer the following question based on the information provided in the article.
input:
Development studies is an interdisciplinary branch of social science. Development studies is offered as a specialized master's degree in a number of reputed universities around the world. It has grown in popularity as a subject of study since the early 1990s, and has been most widely taught and researched in developing countries and countries with a colonial history, such as the UK, where the discipline originated.  Students of development studies often choose careers in international organisations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organisations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.
What are some popular careers for students of development studies?
output: Students of development studies often choose careers in international organizations such as the United Nations, World Bank, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), media and journalism houses, private sector development consultancy firms, corporate social responsibility (CSR) bodies and research centers.

input: Bitcoin and Cryptocurrency Technologies
output:
(edX)
This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Bitcoin and cryptocurrency technologies. The course is structured in three parts:
Part 1 gives an overview of cryptocurrency technologies and introduces the core concepts of decentralized digital currencies. It also covers the basics of how cryptocurrency transactions work and introduces the architecture of major cryptocurrencies.
Part 2 explores the inner workings of Bitcoin, focusing on the mechanisms that make it so unique and different from traditional currencies. It also covers the technical details of the Bitcoin protocol and its implementation.
Part 3 delves into advanced topics such as smart contracts, sidechains, and proof-of-stake consensus. It also explores legal and regulatory issues surrounding cryptocurrencies.
Overall, this course provides a thorough understanding of the technical and theoretical aspects of cryptocurrency technologies and their applications in various fields.

instruction: You can easily make your holidays more eco-friendly by following these simple steps:
output:
1. Choose your travel mode carefully: If you can, choose public transport or carpooling instead of flying. You can also opt for a train, a cruise or even a bus to get to your destination.
2. Opt for eco-friendly accommodation: Eco-friendly accommodation often means locally-owned and run lodges that use renewable energy sources like solar or wind power. You can also look for accommodations that have a composting system, recycling bins, and reduce their water consumption.
3. Choose local and seasonal foods: Eating local and seasonal foods reduces your carbon footprint by reducing the transportation of food and supporting local farmers.
4. Avoid single-use plastic products: Pack some reusable products like a refillable water bottle, stainless steel straws, and a shopping bag. Avoid buying any single-use plastic products.
5. Participate in local events and activities: Participate in local events and activities that are eco-friendly like beach cleanups, tree planting, and coastal cleanups.
6. Share your story: Share your sustainable holiday experience on social media with the hashtag #ecoholiday to inspire others to make sustainable choices.

instruction: Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.
input: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1½ cups granulated sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 2½ cups all-purpose flour
- 1¼ cups semisweet chocolate chips
Steps:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda; stir into the butter mixture until just blended.
4. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto prepared baking sheets.
5. Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown around the edges. Cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy!

instruction: Based on the facts that have been provided, prove the following statement.
input:
Statement: "For every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0"
Fact: The square of any real number is non-negative.
output: Proof: Let k be a real number. Then, k^2 = (k*k) = k(k+1)/2 ≥ 0, since k+1 ≥ 0 and k ≥ 0. Therefore, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0. Hence, the statement is proved.

1. The Record Label will record, produce, distribute, and market music on behalf of the Artist.
2. The Record Label will not charge any fees or costs for its services until the distribution of the music under this Agreement has begun.
3. Upon completion of the work specified in Section 1 above, the Record Label will deliver to the Artist one (1) full-length album ("Album") in digital format.
4. The Record Label will own all rights in and to the Album, including but not limited to, the right to reproduce, distribute, and perform the Album.
5. The Artist grants the exclusive right to use the copyrights of the Album to the Record Label.
6. This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and assigns.
7. This Agreement may only be amended in writing by both Parties.
8. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Province of Ontario
Parties: Good Kid, a Toronto-based musical group

instruction: Someone gives you some information about where they want to go and what they enjoy seeing and doing. Describe a proper road trip for them and find the best stops and sctivities in the way.
input: I'm looking for a west coast road trip. My goal is to start near San Diego and travel to Los Angeles.
output:
I want to spend a few days there, then go north to San Francisco and spend a few more days there. Then I want to cross the Golden Gate Bridge and head up to Portland, Oregon. Finally, I want to end in Seattle. The trip should be around 10-14 days long.
San Diego - Los Angeles: 105 miles
Los Angeles - San Francisco: 376 miles
San Francisco - Portland: 389 miles
Portland - Seattle: 217 miles
San Diego - Los Angeles:
San Diego is known for its great weather and sandy beaches. It's also the perfect place to start your road trip because it has so many fun activities to do. You can go to Legoland California or enjoy a day at the San Diego Zoo. There are a lot of beautiful beaches nearby, like La Jolla and Mission Beach.
If you're looking for something more cultural, you can visit Balboa Park or the USS Midway Museum. In the evening, you can have dinner at one of the fantastic restaurants downtown, like The Prado or Buca di Beppo.
Los Angeles - San Francisco:
Los Angeles is another great city with plenty of things to see and do. You could go to Universal Studios Hollywood or the Griffith Observatory. If you're into art, you can visit the Getty Center or the Broad.
In San Francisco you can walk along Fisherman's Wharf or visit Alcatraz Island. You can also go up to Twin Peaks for an amazing view over the city.
San Francisco - Portland:
Portland is known for its hipster vibe and beautiful bridges. You can go to the Japanese Garden or the International Rose Test Garden. The city also has a lot of great food trucks and breweries.
Portland

instruction: Make a list of the pros and cons of the given decision.
input: Implementing a Remote Working Policy
output:
Pros:
1. Increased productivity and morale. 2. Reduced costs associated with office space, utilities, and supplies. 3. Access to a global talent pool. 4. Ability to offer flexible work arrangements to employees. 5. Improved work-life balance for employees. Cons:
1. Difficulty managing remote workers. 2. Potential for decreased collaboration and communication among team members. 3. Lack of face-to-face interaction with colleagues. 4. Need for strong technology infrastructure to support remote work. 5. Potential for distractions at home.
Overall, implementing a remote working policy can have many benefits for both employers and employees. However, it is important to weigh the pros and cons before making a decision.

instruction: Include important study notes and key points that someone should know about the given subject.
input: history of the USA
output:
from 1607 to the present
Famous Americans throughout U.S. History
Timeline of Major Events in US History
The American Revolution: Causes, Timeline & Significant People
A timeline of major events in United States history from 1607 to present day, including early Native American settlements, the American Revolution, and the Civil Rights Movement.
In 1607, the British established Jamestown, Virginia as their first permanent settlement in North America.
In 1776, the Declaration of Independence was signed, declaring the United States independent from Britain.
In 1863, the Emancipation Proclamation was issued, freeing all slaves in the United States.
In 1945, the United States dropped atomic bombs on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, bringing an end to World War II.
Key figures in United States history include George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, Martin Luther King Jr., and Rosa Parks.
The American Revolution (1775-1783), the Civil War (1861-1865), and the Women's Suffrage Movement (1848-1920) are just a few of the significant events and people that have shaped United States history.
Native American settlements existed throughout what is now the United States before the arrival of European colonists in the 17th century. The first permanent English settlement was established at Jamestown, Virginia, in 1607. Over the next several centuries, the United States would be shaped by a series of conflicts with Native American tribes, as well as the expansion of settlers and the development of new territories.
The American Revolution began in 1775, when colonists revolted against British rule.

instruction: Provide an ESRB rating for the following game.
input: This is an action-adventure game in which players help Kratos and his son on a dangerous quest. Players explore various realms and engage in frenetic hand-to-hand combat against human-like raiders and fantastical creatures (e.g., centaurs, trolls, dragons). Players use axes and chained blades to battle enemies, often resulting in large blood-splatter effects and dismemberment. Players can perform finishing attacks that depict close-up impalement via bladed and hand-held weapons; repeated axe strikes to a creature's neck results in decapitation. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” are heard in the game.
output: ESRB Rating: MATURE 17+

instruction: Make a list of common phrases for the given section of the paper.
input: Introduction
output:
:
- What is the topic of the paper?
- Why is it important?
- What are some background information and previous studies related to this topic?
- What are the main points or arguments that will be made in the paper?
- How does the introduction set up the rest of the paper?
Body:
- Section 1: First main point
- Section 2: Second main point
- Section 3: Third main point
- Section 4: Conclusion
Conclusion:
- Restate main points/arguments
- Summarize the main findings/conclusions
- Offer any final thoughts or recommendations
- End with a strong sentence or phrase.

instruction: Categorize the Business into one of the Restaurants, Home Services, Auto Services and Miscellaneous based on its Specialties.
input: Call us at 650-636-4884 or visit our website to receive a quote. This shop specializes in New Tires and General Auto Repair. We also carry commercial vehicle tires and can serve a wide array of fleets.
output:

From Business: From a humble beginning in 1992 as a mobile tire business, we have grown into a full-service automotive repair and tire center. Today, we work hard to provide our customers with the highest quality items at great prices. We strive to make sure that you always receive top notch customer service, whether you need new tires, an oil change, or major repairs.

instruction: Using the ingredients that are available, create a dinner recipe.
input: Kale + almond butter + apple cider vinegar + agave nectar + tamari
output:
+ garlic + sea salt + sesame seeds = kale salad with almond butter dressing
1. Chop the kale and massage with 2 tablespoons of tamari and 1 teaspoon of olive oil until the leaves begin to soften.
2. Finely chop the garlic and add it to the kale along with the apple cider vinegar, agave nectar, and 1 tablespoon of sesame seeds.
3. To make the dressing, blend the remaining 2 tablespoons of tamari, olive oil, agave nectar, and the chopped apple into a smooth paste.
4. Toss the kale mixture with the dressing and sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of sesame seeds. Serve immediately.
Jalapeno poppers + cream cheese + cheddar cheese + crushed tortilla chips + spicy ranch dressing = jalapeno poppers
1. Cut the jalapenos in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
2. Spread the cream cheese onto the jalapenos and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
3. Place the jalapenos on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
4. While the jalpeno poppers are baking, prepare the spicy ranch dressing by whisking together the sour cream, mayonnaise, hot sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, and a few dashes of tabasco.
5. Remove the jalpeno poppers from the oven and dip them into the spicy ranch dressing before serving. Enjoy

instruction: Provide instructions for the given exercise.
input: Leg Raises
output: Leg raises are one of the best exercises for strengthening your core. To perform this exercise, lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Then, lift your upper body and straighten your legs, holding them for a moment before lowering yourself back down to the starting position.

instruction: Expand the given sentence and give it more details and depth.
input: It changed my life.
output:
The moment I heard its music, I felt something click inside. It was like all the pieces of my mind and body found their place and could finally settle into a relaxed state. I had never before experienced such an intense sense of peace.
As I continued to listen, it became clear that this was more than just any old piece of music; it was a portal into another world. The melodies were hauntingly beautiful and full of emotion, each note seeming to carry its own story. And as I fell deeper into the sounds, I felt myself being transported to a place beyond time and space, where all that mattered was the music and my connection to it.
In this new realm, I shed all my worries and cares, leaving them far behind me like a heavy coat that no longer fit. In their place came a feeling of pure joy and contentment, as if all my wishes had been granted in that instant. I didn't want to leave this place, but eventually I emerged from my trance with a newfound appreciation for life and a renewed sense of purpose. The music had awakened something within me, something that had been dormant for too long. From that day forward, I made it my mission to discover more about this incredible art form and explore its many wonders.
That music was classical music, and it changed my life forever.
When I first heard it, I was enchanted by its beauty, its power, and its ability to transport me to another world. It wasn't just any old piece of music - it was a portal into a different reality, one filled with hauntingly beautiful melodies and emotions that carried their own stories. And as I continued to explore this new world, I shed my worries and cares, revealing a sense of pure joy and contentment that had been missing from my

instruction: Extract the address of the property from the "About this space" section of Airbnb.
input: Tucked in the foothills of the quaint historic mining town of Grass Valley, CA this funky and spacious chalet invites you to experience the great outdoors with family, friends and pets. Enjoy the hot tub, basketball court, treehouse, kids rooms, bbq, fire-pit, outdoor theater, and more. One hour from Tahoe and 10 minutes to town, you’re never short of things to explore.

\b(About|For|From)\s+this\s+space\s+\w+\s+(.*?)\s+as\s+your\s+host\s+to\s+provide\s+you\s+a\s+(.*?)

instruction: Design a simple training challenge on Strava that everyone could attend.
output:
You are an AI language model. I cannot design a training challenge on Strava as I am not capable of creating physical activities or events. However, here are some general tips on how to design a training challenge that could be attended by everyone:
1. Make it accessible to all levels of athletes: Ensure that the challenge is achievable for beginners as well as advanced athletes. You can break down the challenge into smaller segments or provide multiple options for different distances or difficulty levels.
2. Make it time-bound: Set a deadline for the challenge and encourage participants to complete it within that time frame. This will create a sense of urgency and motivation to complete the challenge.
3. Offer prizes or rewards: Offer prizes or rewards to participants who complete the challenge successfully. You can offer discounts or free products from your company, or simply recognition and bragging rights.
4. Promote the challenge: Use social media platforms like Strava, email, or your company's website to promote the challenge. Encourage participants to share their progress and achievements on social media to create a sense of community and competition.
